summary: This is a transcript of a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Lieutenant conducted on March 16, 2022, as part of an investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The interview focuses on camera system failures at MCC New York around August 8-10, 2019, communication about those failures, a phone call allegedly made by Epstein on August 9, and emergency response procedures.

events.title: Camera System Failure Discovered
events.description: Lieutenant discovers the NiceVision camera system at MCC New York is not recording and many camera feeds are blacked out/offline while trying to review footage for an investigation with OIG Agent Omar Daza. She notifies communications technician Hughwon and Captain.

events.title: Alleged Epstein Phone Call
events.description: Hearsay indicates Unit Manager gave Jeffrey Epstein a phone call, allegedly to his mother, from the Special Housing Unit (SHU). A call log for a ~21 minute call starting at 6:58 PM on August 9 is discussed.

events.title: Lieutenant Writes Memo on Camera Failure
events.description: Lieutenant writes and dates a memorandum detailing the camera system failure discovered on August 8 and her interactions with Hughwon.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Found Deceased
events.description: Correctional Officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas discover Jeffrey Epstein in his cell in the Special Housing Unit, leading to activation of emergency body alarms.

events.title: OIG Interview with BOP Lieutenant
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary, sworn interview with a BOP Lieutenant as part of its investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Federal Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC), Brooklyn, New York (interview location)
MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York) - where the discussed events occurred
Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York - where Jeffrey Epstein was housed
5-South housing unit (cadre unit) at MCC New York
keyFacts: The BOP lieutenant discovered a major failure of the NiceVision camera system at MCC New York on August 8, 2019, with many cameras blacked out/offline and none recording, preventing video playback.

There is a discrepancy between the lieutenant's recollection (notifying Captain on August 8) and the captain's statement to OIG (being notified on August 10), highlighted by a memo the lieutenant wrote dated August 10.
Hearsay evidence suggests a BOP Unit Manager gave Jeffrey Epstein a phone call on the night of August 9, 2019, which the lieutenant states was against policy as it was unmonitored and unlogged.

The interview reveals confusion about the repair status of the cameras, with the communications technician stating he 'fixed it yesterday' (August 9) but was there to 'finish up' on August 10, while recordings were still unavailable.

The lieutenant describes standard emergency response procedures involving body alarms on radios, which would have been activated when Epstein was discovered, and notes that all available staff should respond even if off-shift but still in the building.
